thread.title: IN PICTURES: 'This is scary' - Blockades and intimidation for Pretoria residents
thread.title_full: IN PICTURES: 'This is scary' - Blockades and intimidation for Pretoria residents

title: IN PICTURES: 'This is scary' - Blockades and intimidation for Pretoria residents
text:
— Sure Kamhunga (@sure_kamhunga) February 24, 2017 
“They got up at 5 am‚ got into taxis to go attack innocent residents a few kilometres away from Atteridgeville. #Xenophobia.” 
Even her neighbours are turning on each other‚ 
“This is actually scary… I never thought. #Xenophobia. And people from our complex have gone down to join. Ladies in pyjamas.” 
When police arrived to disperse the group‚ her relief was palpable but shortlived. 
“Foq. They threatening us on the balcony from the road… they are coming back #Xenophobia #PretoriaWest… 
“... They keep shouting at us.” Pretoria - #AtteridgevilleProtest - multiple roads closed and @metrorailgp trains suspended pic.twitter.com/lcaxuxTN09 — Rob Byrne (@TrafficSA) February 24, 2017 
She warned a little later: “Stay off #ChurchStreet #WFNkomo. Crowds with weapons walking down that road. Throwing stones. Manhandling people at bus stop.” Its starting again. This convoy of young men driving down #WFNkomo from #Atteridgeville towards #TshwaneCBD pic.twitter.com/S1P9eM6WRD — Matshelela (@nomcnyoni) February 24, 2017 
Another Pretoria resident‚ Tommy T!!!‏@ChabaneTT‚ said early on Friday that protesters had blockaded entrances in and out of Atteridgeville. 
“They blocked all the exits out #Atteridgeville this morning. Our kids can't go to school & we can't go to work.” They blocked all the exits out #Atteridgeville this morning. Our kids can't go to school & we can't go to work. #Tshwaneunrest @Radio702 pic.twitter.com/EyOC5OiBcq — Tommy T!!! (@ChabaneTT) February 24, 2017 
KhathuTha ‏@TheLoneVenda reported‚ “Several taxis‚ bakkies and private cars have arrived here‚ apparently to transport people to Sunnyside. #Atteridgeville #Xenophobia” while Clement Menyuko‏@ClementMenyuko spotted “#Atteridgeville. Burning tyres and gunshots at Seeisi and Moroe Street”. 
Mafatshe_SmarteConn‏@SmarteConn commented: “So we kill our economy and our children's education because of a march? Not fair to the people of Atteridgeville.” 
Academic Tebogo waMathabathe reported a truck getting looted by protesters‚ sharing these photos: @gwalax @Radio702 Delivery truck hi jacked by protesters. Contents unknown at the moment. pic.twitter.com/SeZkUwkfod — Tebogo waMathabathe (@Stoanee) February 24, 2017 Share Tweet SHARE YOUR OPINION If you have an opinion you would like to share on this article, please to the Times LIVE iLIVE team. In the mean time, click here to view the Times LIVE iLIVE section.
